availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
The State of South Carolina
District and City of Charleston.

I, Virginius J. Tobias duly appointed and commissioned by His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette, Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, resident in South Carolina, do solemnly swear, that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner, under and by virtue of the Laws of the Said State of Kentucky.

Sworn and Subscribed to before me this 25th day of November 1865.
J W. Brownfield
c. G. s. s. O. P.

V. J. Tobias
commr for Kentucky

Comr of Deeds
Oath of V J. Tobias
South Carolina
filed 5 Dec/65
